content.description: Start on the two underclings far the right side of the cracked face with high feet. move into the crack and top out on jugs.
content.location: Backside  of the cracked boulder. (opposite the trail)

content.description: Start low right with two good pinches and left foot on a small tooth (blowing the foot will likely result in a stubbed toe). Throw left to the crimp a few feet up. Bump left again to the slopey crimp rail and slap the right arete for the crux. Traverse left to top out.
content.location: On the face to the right of Two Knuckles. Look right and see the whale boulder.

content.description: Sit start the amazing scooping arete to the left of Two Knuckles. Make a big move to get off the ground and then finish directly out the arete on some difficult to see holds on the top. The topo photo with red lines indicates the direction that you would go for DS, not the direct finish.
content.location: The obvious arete just to the left of Two Knuckles that just screams to be climbed.

content.description: Sit start the arete to the left of two knuckles, follow it all the way through the "scoop" on slopers until you top out on good holds directly over the "death spike".... great movement. bad landing.
content.protection: at least 2 pads and a spotter.
content.location: Same as Death Spike Direct on the backside of he split boulder.

content.description: As you approach this set it is on the right side of the trail.
